brief_summary.textblock:
This study is a single center, randomized pilot study to evaluate the clinical effectiveness
      of nasal high flow 20LPM humidification therapy in subjects with Cystic Fibrosis.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating High Flow Humidification Therapy in Patients With Cystic Fibrosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Confirmed diagnosis of CF

          -  10 years of age and older

          -  Subject is able to comply with the procedures scheduled in the protocol

          -  Signed informed consent form

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Receipt of any aerosolized experimental or investigational drugs within 1 month of
             enrollment

          -  Subject had ear, nose, and throat (ENT) surgery, nasal bleeding, or nasal polyps
             within 6 months prior to study

          -  Subject is unlikely to comply with the procedures scheduled in the protocol

          -  Inability to give informed consent

          -  Require supplemental oxygen

          -  History of obstructive sleep apnea

          -  History of pressure headaches requiring therapy in the preceding month

intervention.description: Nasal high flow humidification therapy wil be administered using Optiflow with Airvo 2.

clinical_study.keyword: To evaluate the effectiveness of high flow 20 liters per minute (LPM) humidification therapy.

facility.name: Children's Hospital of Richmond at VCU

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating High Flow Humidification Therapy in Patients With Cystic Fibrosis

primary_outcome.description: The Cystic Fibrosis Questionnaire-Revised (CFQ-R) is a validated health-related quality of life measure for CF that meets US Food and Drug Administration psychometric requirements for patient reported outcomes.  It contains both generic and CF-specific scales and has demonstrated responsiveness in previous clinical studies.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Sputum is collected during pulmonary function test (PFT) to later measure the biophysical properties of cystic fibrosis sputum.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
